Hi Kent,

Kent Beck wrote:
> Teemu Kanstren wrote:
> > something like this should work for it too (in your test code):
> >
> > Process p = Runtime.exec("java mystuff")
> >
> > int exitcode = p.waitFor();
> > assertmystuff(exitcode,...);
>
>  While this looks like it should work, it turns out that Linux
> and OSX handle return codes differently than Windows.
> We have an open defect in JUnit because of this. If anyone
> has a portable way to get a return code back from a forked
> Java process I'd like to hear about it.

Are you possibly referring to the same issue I responded to in the
following thread?
http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/17336

Have you tried the fix I suggested?

-Lasse-
